datafield.subfield: Observation of $D^0 \to \rho^0\gamma$ and Search for $CP$ Violation in Radiative Charm Decays

We report the first observation of the radiative charm decay $D^{0}^{0}$ and the first search for CP violation in decays $D^{0}^{0}$, , and $\bar{K}$*0(892), using a data sample of 943fb$^{1}$ collected with the Belle detector at the KEKB asymmetric-energy $e^{+}e^$ collider. The branching fraction is measured to be B($D^{0}^{0}$)=(1.770.300.07)10$^{5}$, where the first uncertainty is statistical and the second is systematic. The obtained CP asymmetries A$_{CP}$($D^{0}^{0}$)=+0.0560.1520.006, A$_{CP}$($D^{0}^{0}$) = 0.0940.0660.001, and A$_{CP}$($D^{0}\bar{K}*^{0}$)=0.0030.0200.000 are consistent with no CP violation. We also present an improved measurement of the branching fractions B($D^{0}^{0}$)=(2.760.190.10)10$^{5}$ and B($D^{0}\bar{K}*^{0}$)=(4.660.210.21)10$^{4}$.
